html:
Pinterest retains your User Content even after you delete either the content from your account, or your account altogether.

https://about.pinterest.com/en/terms-service

2(c)  “Following termination or deactivation of your account, or if you remove any User Content from Pinterest, we may retain your User Content for a commercially reasonable period of time for backup, archival, or audit purposes. Furthermore, Pinterest and its users may retain and continue to use, store, display, reproduce, re-pin, modify, create derivative works, perform, and distribute any of your User Content that other users have stored or shared through Pinterest.”

--
[!!] Please see https://edit.tosdr.org -- this is where new contributions should be submitted and discussed
 
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: [Bad] Pinterest retains your User Content
text:
Pinterest retains your User Content even after you delete either the 
content from your account, or your account altogether.

https://about.pinterest.com/en/terms-service

2(c)  “Following termination or deactivation of your account, or if you 
remove any User Content from Pinterest, we may retain your User Content for 
a commercially reasonable period of time for backup, archival, or audit 
purposes. Furthermore, Pinterest and its users may retain and continue to 
use, store, display, reproduce, re-pin, modify, create derivative works, 
perform, and distribute any of your User Content that other users have 
stored or shared through Pinterest.”

-- 
[!!] Please see https://edit.tosdr.org -- this is where new contributions should be submitted and discussed
